poem:
### The Bargaining

In corridors of power where whispers  
coil like smoke, a signature waits—  
ink poised to sever the thread.  
Across oceans, pills and promises  
drop like coins into the cup  
of the world's unquiet dreams.  
O men of influence,  
your gifts are like season's rains—  
never falling where truly needed.
